name: Hudson Taylor
summary: British Protestant Christian missionary to China and founder of the China Inland Mission. Taylor spent 51 years in China and was known for adopting Chinese dress and customs.

biography.title: Early Life and Calling
biography.content: James Hudson Taylor was born on 21 May 1832 in Barnsley, Yorkshire, England. At age 17, he experienced a spiritual conversion and felt called to serve as a missionary to China.

biography.title: First Journey to China
biography.content: In 1854, at age 21, Taylor sailed to China under the Chinese Evangelization Society. He worked in Shanghai and learned Chinese language and customs.

biography.title: China Inland Mission
biography.content: In 1865, Taylor founded the China Inland Mission (CIM), an interdenominational mission organization that became one of the largest missionary societies in China.

biography.title: Indigenous Approach
biography.content: Taylor pioneered wearing Chinese clothing and adopting local customs, believing this would make the Gospel more acceptable to Chinese people. This approach was initially controversial but proved effective.

timeline.description: James Hudson Taylor born in Yorkshire, England
Experienced conversion and call to missions at age 17
Sailed to China under Chinese Evangelization Society
Came back due to illness but continued promoting China missions
Established mission organization focusing on interior China
Led group of 16 missionaries to China
CIM lost 58 missionaries and 21 children during persecution
Passed away in China after 51 years of service

quiz.question: What mission organization did Hudson Taylor found?
quiz.explanation: Hudson Taylor founded the China Inland Mission in 1865.

quiz.question: What was unique about Taylor's missionary approach?
options: He adopted Chinese dress and customs
He only worked with other denominations
quiz.explanation: Taylor was known for adopting Chinese clothing and customs to better connect with the people.

quiz.question: How many years did Hudson Taylor serve in China?
quiz.explanation: Taylor spent 51 years serving in China, from 1854 until his death in 1905.

quiz.question: During which event did CIM lose many missionaries?
quiz.explanation: During the Boxer Rebellion in 1900, CIM lost 58 missionaries and 21 children.
